column3: Interested in the use of the underscore as the variable name here, did some reading and from what I've read use of the underscore only works as something other than a variable name when used in an interactive python shell? Other than that people seem to believe it's a bad naming convention.\n\nContext: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/26895362/what-does-in-python-do
`_` as a variable name in python is a convention to indicate that the result won't be used.
Thanks for the explanation, makes sense.

Is the order of deletion relevant? If not, something like this is both easier to read and likely more efficient:
```
for x in self.p2ps:
    if x.connection is not None:
        x.connection.disconnect_node()
self.p2ps = []
```
No, the order is not relevant. Will switch to your suggestion. (I tried to minimize the --ignore-all-space diff)
